Fitzgerald (Ryan Gosling), a disaffected teenager who has apparently murdered a severely retarded peer, the brother of popular high school student Allison (Jodi Foster) leads to an extraordinary trial that weighs moral response to a child's illness against the demands of justice. Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, which he spent intensively reading books, and his young adulthood in Chicago, which proved to be a formative experience.
